DataElement.preferredName: Patient Prior American College of Surgeons Oncology Group Clinical Trial Identifier Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the unique patient identifier of the prior American College of Surgeons Oncology Group study on which a patient or participant was enrolled.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Prior American College of Surgeons Oncology Group Clinical Trial Identifier
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to patient identifier assigned from a prior ACOSOG, a cooperative group sponsored by the NCI whose primary goal is to evaluate surgical therapies in the management of patients with malignant solid tumors, clinical trial, a type of research study that tests how well new medical treatments or other interventions work in people.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Prior American College of Surgeons Oncology Group Clinical Trial Identifier
Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:The American College of Surgeons Oncology Group (ACOSOG) is a cooperative group sponsored by the NCI whose primary goal is to evaluate surgical therapies in the management of patients with malignant solid tumors. The ACOSOG (Durham, NC) includes general and specialty surgeons, representatives of related oncologic disciplines and allied health professionals in academic medical centers and community practices throughout the US and foreign countries. The group is composed of the Administrative Coordinating Center and the Statistics and Data Coordinating. Both groups are based at the Duke Clinical Research Institute.:A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes. Interventions include but are not restricted to drugs, cells and other biological products, surgical procedures, radiologic procedures, devices, behavioral treatments, process-of-care changes, and preventive care.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.longName: American College of Surgeons Oncology Group
Concepts.definition: A cooperative group sponsored by the NCI whose primary goal is to evaluate surgical therapies in the management of patients with malignant solid tumors. The ACOSOG (Durham, NC) includes general and specialty surgeons, representatives of related oncologic disciplines and allied health professionals in academic medical centers and community practices throughout the US and foreign countries. The group is composed of the Administrative Coordinating Center and the Statistics and Data Coordinating. Both groups are based at the Duke Clinical Research Institute.
A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the numeric or alphanumeric identification assigned to the study by the National Cancer Institute.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the identification of cancer research protocols.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

DataElement.origin: ACOSOG CRF:American College of Surgeons Oncology Group Case Report Form
